message_1: A school has 21 students and wants to form basketball teams to compete in a tournament. Each team must have 5 players. How many different teams can be formed, and how many players will be left without a team?
message_2:
To determine the number of different teams that can be formed, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of students (21), k is the number of students per team (5), and ! denotes the factorial function.

C(21, 5) = 21! / (5!(21-5)!)
C(21, 5) = 21! / (5!16!)
C(21, 5) = (21*20*19*18*17) / (5*4*3*2*1)
C(21, 5) = 4084101 / 120
C(21, 5) = 34034

So, 34,034 different teams can be formed.

To find out how many players will be left without a team, we can use the modulo operation:

21 students % 5 players per team = 1 player left without a team.

Therefore, 34,034 different teams can be formed, and 1 player will be left without a team.
